name: Bertdell Estep
text: Nice enough people, started the process quickly and were thorough. Never sent anyone to finish our interior trim though. After close to a year in our home the trim still is unfinished, door stops not secured, there are two screws under our flooring, our cabinet finish had been nicked and there is a small hole, counter top trim is damaged, around the bathtubs isn't properly caulked. We were told that all of these we’re going to be handled within two months. It’s now been nine months with no responses to my emails, no repairs, and we are simply going to do it ourselves despite being told in February that someone would be out shortly to fix it.

name: Greg Herring
text: Love this place "1in service and quality and are very nice if you need a Home Ck them out

name: Jameson Smith
text: Best place ive ever been to buying anything. Couldn't have asked for better service. They made sure to get us in the mobile home we wanted. Not only did we talk about buying a home but we also talked about everything under the sun. I highly recommend them to anyone.

name: MO Mules
text: If you like to be told what to buy and how much to spend this is the place to go.  I went elsewhere, got the model I wanted and saved more than $30,000 on it.  Thank goodness I didn't buy here.

name: Larry Pride
text: I was told I wouldn’t be able to buy a home for 10+ years because of a bankruptcy. I couldn’t even get th to run my credit. I went somewhere else, got a deal on a home, and I’m glad I didn’t believe what I was told here. I do NOT recommend medowbrook homes.

text: The home I bought from them has had a leaking roof since the beginning and they “fixed” it by caulking it. I do not recommend them.

text: Shady  always read or take paper work to ur lawyer

text: Beautiful homes and very helpful,  friendly salesmen.   Highly recommend, if you're looking for a new home!

name: Adam Rivera
text: We had excellent service and help with picking out our home. They were amazing at answering our many questions that my wife and I had. They walked us through the the process very easily. The set up was clean and quickly after the house was delivered. The only complaint we have had is the company they hire to do their air conditioning services. We have had a hard time getting them to come out and set up things and now we are having problems with our unit and can’t get anyone to come out and help us.

name: Willie Wright
text: They have some of the most beautiful homes I have ever laid eyes on if I didn't already have the one I've got I would definitely buy one of theirs

name: jason Fields
text: Great place to buy a mobile home.

name: Richard Ask
text: They have a ton of homes here to look through, I like the low pressure sales approach ( here is a golf cart, it's 10 acres, let us know if you have a question) take notes of which home you have what question about to make it smoother. Only gripe I have and yes it may be Petty however, put a few almost completely together, it's hard to say I may really like a home if there is a bunch of pieces in each room that go on ceiling or walls, or even doors. Feels like am shopping an incomplete kit

name: Hannah Alexander
text: Joey was very friendly and helpful! But the company doesn’t seem to care about fixing our home. It was delivered to my land in October of 2018. It’s now January and our house is not complete. The owner claimed we were ripping them off??????? Ridiculous. I paid cash for the house and all I want is for it to be complete so we can all move on. They have beautiful homes but just be aware of who you are working with.

text: Lots off home's to choose from friendly service clean facilities if you're looking for a home give them a try the salesman aren't pushed and that's a good thing

name: Ronny Perkins

name: J
text: I just got off the phone with Home Place and I am very displeased with my experience. I called to inquire about a certain modular home my husband and I were interested in and the lady that I spoke with seemed to care less about answering my questions. I asked her very simple financing questions, (finance in house or lend through banks) and I also asked about how down payments usually work and she seemed so confused by the question?! Like why are you even asking me that question...  I just felt during the entire conversation that I asked very complex questions or that I was asking stupid questions! I was so fed up dealing with the lady that I seem to have interrupted so I hung up. I expected someone who was very friendly and helpful and in turn I got the opposite. We will take our business to someone else who would actually like to help us and get our business.

name: Glenn Johnson
text: Mr. Bruce was awesome with helping us getting our new home and I will recommend him and Jaco Sales to everyone! name: Mark Miree
text:
Very simple. If you want a complete buying experience, go to Jaco. They have everything you will pay up front and honest and listed on a board in every home. No hidden costs to consider. Jarred Jones is a GREAT man to work with and will work his tail off to make sure that the entire deal meets your expectations. They help with finding contractors to do needed prep work and constantly keep you informed on where things stand.
The moving company is super efficient and professional. They were done with a tough move in hours, not days.
Finishing/trim crew did great work and on time. Terry Jones is simply THE MAN on doing his work. Goes above and beyond in every way.
Wish every buying experience was as pleasant as this one was. I was on a very tight time line and really didn’t expect to meet it. But, thanks to the Jaco team, it happened. Shocked and extremely pleased. Look no further for a place to buy your home. These guys will take care of you.

Everyone was great, friendly and very helpful for any questions. Bruce went above and beyond to answer all my questions and seen everything through until the end.

Great company and would definitely purchase from again!

name: Stephanie Mcdonald
text: Working with Bubba and Christina. They are patient and kind! We have a trillion questions and they make the time to answer them all. They work extra hard to get you what you need and want. They try to make the process as easy as pie. If you want to buy a home come here!!

name: Robyn Z
text: My folks ordered a custom made home and was delivered a turd. Outside walls were not straight. The guys who are contracted to finish walls and paint after the home is set did the worst job ever. And when you point things out they say to you "you do realize you bought  a manufactured home right?" They painted all the wall in the house 3 times and still messed it up. Streaked, patchy, horribly unprofessional. They put the saw inside and cut all the wood trim INSIDE THE HOME! Nails are comming up in the floor. Siding comes loose or off because of the lack of attachment. Outside wall bowed. Inside walls also had some bowing.  Problems in the construction of this home from factory to the finishing of it on property. All problems were never fixed. And it's now over a yr. So they never will. Do not trust the sales people either . They will smile in your face and assure you things will be great. But as soon as you get your screwed up cheap home they start pointing fingers to someone else is in charge of fixing that. Just because it's custom doesn't mean they take more care in it.

No Thank You!!!

resp.text: 👍 If you would have read further google also shows that Allen's is closed. But to leave a review without having service or any experience with the company makes your review kind of irrelevant. Best wishes to you and your new mobile home and your movers.

name: Jessica Campbell
text: They are really great people! Intelligent group of people, that know how to get the job done right! Very prompt and respectful! I'd highly recommend them to anyone! Give them a call for all your mobile home moving needs! You won't be sorry! Never seen a job they can't do!

name: Brennen Davis
text:
Update:
Thank you, "Allen's Mobile Home Movers!" Get moved with the best, or left like the rest! If you need a mobile home moved, I suggest you call them! It took a while to get mine on spot but........this weather has played the main roll in that! It was put on spot, today and.......I'm the happiest person alive! They're the best, and I'd suggest them to anyone! They have a GREAT group of guys, that work hard! I really can't thank them enough! It's been a rough ordeal but, y'all did it! 🙏❤️🙏❤️🙏❤️🙏❤️

I wish I could give them more than 5 stars, they deserve it. It's moving day and let me just start out by saying.......I'm glad and blessed to have: "Allen's Mobile Home Movers," to do the job. They've worked long and hard to get the job done. They've ran into many obstacles along the way and they've overcome, them ALL! They started last night, worked late and are back at it again today! They haven't let me down, at all! They are amazing people that care and get the job done right! I'd recommend them to anyone I know! They are reasonably priced and know what they are doing. We had a deadline to have the trailer moved and they met it. We love Wendy and Mike, they are like family now! If your needing a mobile home moved, then they are the ones to call! You won't be sorry! Thank y'all, so much! It means a LOT, to finally have this off my chest!

resp.text: Thank you, It was a pleasure meeting your family and helping you get this move done. That's what it's about making friends and family along the way while making it affordable to all our customers. Please don't hesitate to call us anytime.

text:
The G. Cooper job was never finished!

Half the job ... might as well be none at all.
Months have passed and this company ignores efforts to contact them!
It could happen to you!
BEWARE!

text: Would give a negative -100 stars. Rudest and unsafest haulers I have ever seen. Needs license revoked. Would suggest No one use them. Safety is definitely not their concern. resp.text: Mrs. Bartlett, Our top concern is safety and a successful move for our customers. Which in fact you are not one of our customers. We have 30 years successful accident free. If you have a concern you should contact our office 338-6785

name: Trent Thomas
text: Out of court with them, 31 days after court was ruled in my favor now I proceed again. This is your warning doing Business with these people.  I had to pay another company to finish the job and take them to small claims. I have never  been treated or lied to like this before with a business only to find out I'm not the only one. They will say I slandered them and I'm lying but everything is documented legally. From what I have learned, check license, bonds, insurance, and Never pay up front like I did. Pay them after the Job is done! Back to court we go. Will update in a few months. Edit..... this is 2020 and they have 17 complaints. Do not use these people, They have yet to try to pay any money back that was court ordered! They are con artists.

name: Harry Bradford
text:

text: I purchased a small double wide from them in May 2019. I had a terrible experience and I was a 1st time buyer. I was excited to be buying my own new home. Don't get me wrong the staff was wonderful it was the owner Cliff Davis, everytime I came in asking questions to the sales person I was working with when thing didn't look right he'd always take over and give along speech and side track the original question. They never would give me all the paper work at one time I'd have to keep coming back because there was always something else needing to be signed. He makes it seem like he's helping you out but the whole time he's trying to get you for as much as he can. In the end I was still over charged for my home and I'm sure I was over charged for the dirt pad too. I was suppose to have gotten a discount for my home because it was the display, they charged me the regular price and made it seem like I was getting a discount. Once I finally realized this it was too late the purchasing process had been completed.  When I got my home finally it took forever to get everything finish, I almost lost my house insurance because they took so long to put it up. I called them so many times and sent pictures of repairs that needed to be done. My stove had a huge dent in the back and my floor was messed up from where somebody previously tried to move it. He said he would replace it and they didn't. I wouldn't advice anyone to buy a home from here, if your inexperienced and a 1st time buyer please be careful.

name: Von Von
text:
We had a really positive experience and so appreciate the help we received.  We are senior citizens and had some difficulty with financing. Constantine was most helpful: he researched our different options.  It took a bit longer since financial institutions wanted assurance the loan would be recouped. Constantine spent time working with us until he located a lender who presented us with a payment schedule we could meet.

At each juncture, Constantine constantly reassured us we would get the home we had chosen. Finally,  everything came together and we are  living in our beautiful new home.

Be assured that every contractor Mr. Davis sent to set up the house arrived on time. They were very professional and,  again,  we are pleased with the results.

A feature that Mr. Davis incorporates is "buyer afterbuy information." Constantine visited us after we had moved in with a booklet full of tips and vital information.  This is the only company that provides this valuable feature. The tips were invaluable.  I've lived in mobile homes for decades and never knew I'm not supposed to wash my mobile home with Clorox!

At our age, my husband and I thought we were settled.  We never imagined that we would have to buy a new home, so we were unnerved when the reality set in. We were so fortunate to find Cliff Davis Homes. Constantine and the rest of the staff eased the process and we are delighted. Without equivocation,  my husband and I recommend Cliff Davis Homes.

text:
These people turned my first home-buying experience into a disaster. They are a family of cheap manipulators who seem to not know how to communicate well enough to run a business. I purchased a home from them, They were all "Promises and Rainbows" Until i signed the closing documents. Then it was a month to get a lot model onto my property, 3 trips to attempt to do finishing work without proper materials, Neither of my doors worked properly (i had to barricade my front door and rig my rear door so my home was secure because they never came out to even attempt to fix them) when my home arrived and i didn't even receive keys for my back door at first nor was i informed of the missing keys, I made the mistake of having them do my septic which was a whole load lies (turns out the guy they were using quit on due to bad publicity), after they did a 2 day rush job on the last minute finishing work and skirting they missed several cracks in the sheet rock walls and when they had to return to fix them i gave a copy of my floorplan and marked the bad areas with a "X" and they missed a entire room completely along with making a horrible home seam (double wide) worse and spraying paint on my carpet. I signed my closing documents on March 3rd, its now June 23rd and they are refusing to repair my home any further even though the manufacturer has told us that the repairs are their responsibility. Apparently i get to clean up their mess because its my fault they have incompetent employees and poor communication.

On another note, they DO NOT use manufacturer approved footings (found that out in hindsight) and DO NOT have their own service crew, everything is through cheapest third party installer they can find so don't expect a timely or good job on your install.

My advice if you are looking for a home is DO NOT USE CLIFF DAVIS HOME CENTER, and pay another dealer a little extra to have the home manufacturer install your home, you will get better service and a guarantee on the repairs, not sorry excuses and horrible service.

text: I HIGHLY do not recommend going through Cumberland Homes. They put up a good front to get business from you but definitely do not care about your business. It took them almost a month and a half to set up our trailer; trim, fix cracks they put in the walls, etc. We literally had to beg, call every day, and do everything short of pulling to teeth to get them to finish setting up our trailer.  We were supposed to get a washer and dryer from them, they tried to con us out of it. We signed a contract that we had to get our own contractor to do the dirt pad.. the owner sent his family member to our house who 1. Did not know the measurements of our trailer, did a horrible job. 2. Just to try to con us out of money and we ended up having to pay another contractor to fix what they messed up. If I could give them 0 stars I definitely would. I highly suggest taking your business somewhere else. Save your money and just build a house y’all it is not worth it.

resp.text: When we trim a sheet rock house we wait until you get the power and water hooked up. it took you about 3 weeks to get the power and water to the house. When we began to trim the house, we discovered the factory did not ship all the parts, we had to order those parts. We ordered parts, received parts and trimmed your house out within two weeks of you getting power and water. You watched contractor build the site all day and at the end of the day you did not pay, and said you where not gonna pay. So that contractor did not finish. We waited on you to finish since you said that you wanted to do your own site prep. You did nothing to the site so we hired a contractor to finish the site prep. The second contractor cost about the same as what the washer and dryer cost. We asked you if you would trade the washer and dryer for site prep. So we tried to get you to pay for the site prep, you said that you would. We let you have the washer and dryer. You still have not paid for any portion of the site prep. So now you write a bad review after not paying from two different people. I would delete this review because it makes you look far worse.

name: David Mcdougal
text:
Purchased a double wide Clayton Home. We had only seen it on the video due to COVId 19. My wife spent a week (a solid 40 plus hours) trying to satisfy the requirements of the mortgage company. She couldn’t so she called to tell the salesman that we would be unable to purchase the home. He replied with, well send me what you have, I usually deal with them anyway. So the mortgage got approved. I was told by my salesman that he had gotten us approved with no payment for 90 days. One of the guys at the mortgage company actually laughed when I told him I was told 90 days no payment. We go sign papers 4/21 and cannot sign the papers in our home because they have started prepping it for delivery. We had to be out of the house we were renting so ok, this should be quick and easy. We were told a few weeks to MOVE in. It took a month just to deliver a ready home!That was 5/15. We moved in 6/10. I asked the salesman while looking him in the eyes if I would need to arrange to have the power, water, or septic tank connected. His reply to me was “no, we handle all that and it’s financed in”.
So Regional sends a man out to make our dirt pad. Supposed to be paid for in the mortgage. Guy says we need 17 loads of dirt and that we will have to either get the dirt or we could pay him around $2000 on top of what Regional was paying him for the pad work. Our lot is not that Unlevel to start with. We hired our own guy who did the pad and supplied the dirt for what Regional was going to pay their guy. They called our guy 4 times a day for a week till it got done. We are then told it was going to be another week before they delivered our home. That week comes and we are told for 5 straight days “ it’s gonna be delivered tomorrow, I promise” and it didn’t show till the end of the following week. And my wife drove an hour one way every day to meet them as she was told one of us would need to be there.So we get the septic tank installed and the water meter installed. We call our salesman to let him know and we are told that we have to provide someone to hook that up. So we get power and make the call to get our AC installed. No reply for over a week. We try to reach the general manager and can only leave messages because he is always busy and apparently doesn’t return calls between meeting (or ever). On day 3 of asking for him, the guy says, you keep calling, is there something I can help you with?. So we find out that he is the guy who arranges the AC and underpinning and finish work. He claims he hasn’t been told we had power and were ready for AC install and underpinning but he would get right on it even though three days before my wife had texted the salesman and he said he’d let them know.He called back 3 days later and said he had it set up for Monday. Monday comes and is almost gone so we call him back. He says he doesn’t know where they are and gives us the number to the AC company. They advised us that they had nothing scheduled for us to install. They simply told him they would have the unit in stock on Monday. Now the AC folks did a great job. They had a cancellation and came a day earlier than the appointment they made with us actually. I am about to make my second payment and the house is still not underpinned and we have heard nothing from the manufacturer as to when they are coming to fix all the broken drawers and the screwed up electrical. If you turn off the light outside the laundry room door to the outside, none of the lights in the living room will work.
Long story I know but I will live in a cardboard box before I buy another home from Regional Mobile Homes in Northport. We are now being told it will be another 2 to 3 weeks before they come do our underpinning. Oh and there is absolutely nothing holding this home to the ground. No straps or anchors. The Alabama Mobile Home  commission  says that it acceptable , but I have never seen a mobile home in Alabama that wasn’t strapped and anchored. They will do the minimum they can do. Not above and beyond like they say on the website. I wish I could give them negative stars.

resp.text: Hey David - I’m sorry you were unhappy with the service you received at Regional Homes. Our number one priority is to meet and exceed expectations at every interaction. Since we don’t have much control over the manufacturer servicing, we do everything in our power to get issues resolved for you quickly but that’s not always the case. We will keep working hard to get these issues taken care of more promptly!

Financial person, Heath, flat out stated that they didnt care about our business because they were busy already. Information about the buying process was not shared up front. And prices 'increase' suspiciously. We even called other companies to check this info and this was not the case. Beware! Buying a home is a HUGE decision that costs a lot of money! these people are not professional and are not trustworthy. Go somewhere else!

This company will waste your time and are sleazy as grease. dont let them get a hold of your money! We were almost ready to sign with them after months of strained communication and a growing uneasy feeling in my gut, when they threw out some pretty big requirements we were never told about over 6 months of talking and preparing for a real, serious home purchase. contractors were lined up and everything. We were told prices had increased magically per foot in the house the week prior and that it required a 10% deposit on the value of the home before building...we called around to other mobile home sites and they reacted like this was the normal, to get these phone calls about this company, Cumberland Homes. Evidently we are not the first people they have done this to. the other mobile home companies in Alabama STRONGLY cautioned us that no prices had changed due to the annual convention, everything was status quo, and what they are suggesting is an unethical and NOT practiced requirement of a 10% deposit on top of the down payment for your home mortgage. You have been warned, people.

**update in response to company comment**
no sir, I am simply being thorough in my review. i have not used any "fictitious name". i simply left the same review on facebook and google. what my review states is truth. you seem to be having the tantrum because people are responding to my review with similar experiences until you took down the reviews on facebook. Let me be clear. I am not worried about you. I have not given you a second thought. i simply shared my experience to warn others. looks like yall are still stuck on it. interesting. you can speak whatever things that make you sleep better at night. I am not bitter, I am not mad, i am simply sharing the truth. I am GLAD it didnt work out now. you can excuse what you did all the ways you wish, you cannot take it back. STOP WASTING MY TIME AND MAKING YOURSELF EVEN LESS PROFESSIONAL. learn from your actions. evidently yall have reputation  that follows your company name. so sad.

Also, the "cousin" you mentioned is aware of everything and has been very cautious with you. he stayed simply because of pricing, not because he was impressed by your business. i hope you treated him better, though! it seems like it. Learning from mistakes is great.

Lastly, something to note. I only add more detail to my review when you respond unprofessionally....

resp.text: Ok,   You have already left one Review under a fictitious name and used the same type rhetoric.  Concerning the price increases,  Different Manufactured home dealers have different business arrangements with the factories based on volume and other factors so you have no idea as to what you are talking about concerning our pricing or any other Manufactured Home dealership.  Look Kayla we made a decision not to do business with you based on your behavior is the truth of the matter and this type of response from you just validates our decision.  What it seems like you are doing is simply having a tantrum because you didn't get your way.  No company wants to turn down business for obvious reasons but in your case we felt we had no choice.  Yes deposits are required on special order homes that nobody else would ever want if for some reason you can't or don't go through with the purchase is not unreasonable in our opinion.  This is the type of behavior that helped us make a decision not to do business with you and we don't regret that decision by any means.   It seems like the timing of this review is very suspicious since your cousins home will be delivering very soon and they have been very reasonable and great to work with through the whole process and we truly hope they enjoy their new home for many years to come.  We also would like to thank you for referring them to us.  Once their home is delivered we will mail your referral check.   Good luck to you in the future,  best wishes..

text: Terrible customer service. Our company buys lots of used mobile homes and we have never had an experience like this one. This company seems to be only interested in making the sale but not servicing the customer. Buy elsewhere.

resp.text: I am sorry that you are unsatisfied with your used house. The house did not come with cut off valves when it was built 25 years ago. You told me the stove did not work even though we dont carry warranties on the appliances , we bought one from Lowes but they could not get in touch with you to deliver with the phone number you gave me. A month later you said the fridge did not work, so I replied that you could replace it with another if you wanted to pick it up. Send me a bill for the keys and I will refund your out of pocket cost. I did not know you did not have keys.

text: An awful experience that we want to put behind us! DeerValley has been helpful, just wish I could say the same about Wes Madison and Cumberland.

resp.text: Cheryl if you would have asked for a heat pump we would have gladly got one for you,  you did not ask for a heat pump, you were not charged for one. That is contracted out through a different company. Cumberland Homes does not install the heating and cooling systems. And yes your house did get a leak in the plastic when it was on the lot but the factory striped everything down to the studs and replaced what ever was damaged, there is no mildew in your house ever thing that was damaged was replaced, As far as delivery, YOUR COUSIN  delivered the house, he was in charge of scheduling when he could deliver your house and it was wet the entire time he was trying to deliver. Your house had to be pulled in with a skider and your entire site had to be matted because it was so wet, that is why it took him longer to deliver. I have been out to your house to see the issues that you are speaking of, and the factory is scheduled to take care of your issues. Deer Valley is the best built house on the market, Your house is energy star compatible, thermal zone III, heat shield on the roof, Low E gold seal thermal Croft Windows. Your house  is built to conserve on heating and cooling.

name: Heather Alford
text: We tossed around the idea of a "mobile home" as it's far more affordable. However not all of these homes are created equal. They can be beautiful on the inside but very cheaply made. What's in the walls and structure counts big time. That being said, if you're considering this type of option, skip Clayton (subpar materials, building standards, still stuck in the 90s), and go here and opt for a Deer Valley home. Built w 2x6 beams, hella thick insulation, you can have recessed lighting, sheetrock walls, 9ft ceilings, the list goes on. In Alabama that wind rating is going to matter. In most brands if you want these options you're gonna pay the price like punishment for wanting a higher standard. I'll let my pictures speak for themselves on what you get for your money. Worth a look. And our salesman was no pressure but very professional. That matters bc they can usually be as bad as used car salesmen.

name: Steven Schrimsher
text:
Update - 5 months later
The A/C got installed on Memorial Day (major kudos to the guy who drove out to install the crossover on the holiday and for that I'm returning 1 star, however that situation should've never happened in the first place). Underpinning got installed approx 1 month later.

There are repairs that are needed now which should fall under warranty, however I am not confident they will do quality work ("they gave us a bad review, so we'll do just enough" type of deal). That said, who knows - maybe things have changed internally and they'd see this as an opportunity.

A lot of the headache around our purchase (and the subsequent bad review) probably could have been avoided with better communication both internally (within their company) and externally (with contractors they hired and with us). Buyer beware is all I can say. If you go with them, I hope you have a better experience than we did. While I still don't necessarily recommend them I do hope that, in the months since we purchased, they have been able to fix whatever issues caused the hiccups with our experience and provide a better product for future customers.

Original review:
AVOID THIS PLACE. Our experience declined when they ceased to be Dream Home Outlet and became regional homes of Cullman. Been waiting months to get into our house because their installers can't do anything right (no AC in half our home because they forgot the crossovers, AC unit installed in an improper location, water crossovers improperly installed, missing door hardware, etc). We have been patient about waiting but enough is enough. The goalposts keep moving- first it was one day, then two days, then weeks. Shame that I can't even live in the house that I'm already making payments on. Moe, Wendy, and Les are all decent enough people but there's a major hangup somewhere for these types of issues to be so prevalent, and because of that (in addition to the lack of requested -repeatedly- communication) I cannot recommend anyone go here when looking for their new home.

AVOID AVOID AVOID

name: Angel Galloway
text: We purchased our home 4 years ago, the staff, salesman ect.. were super easy to work with no complaints about them however our buccaneer home has never been what it was supposed to be. From the looks it's beautiful but very cheaply built. Our kitchen drawers fell apart within 1 month of moving in. In fact one drawer stayed out for over a year waiting on them to order a new one. Our bathroom cabinet door broke off, all the trim (particle board) all throughout has peeled up. The carpet has never been tacked down properly and the carpet itself is the bare cheapest and you can look at and see that. We made a huge mistake in buying a buccaneer from Clayton homes and I cannot believe those nice men that work for Clayton would actually associate their own good names to sell homes so cheaply made. Definitely not worth the money

resp.text: Hi Angel- we sincerely appreciate you reaching out and sharing your feedback with us. We thrive on customer feedback in order to better our building processes, and we will forward this to our manufacturers. If you need to reach out for any reason, please call us at 205-755-4023.- Tim Slaney, G.M. Clayton Homes of Clanton

text: Well Lemmond's claims to guarantee that their old, run down, over-priced crappy mobile homes are in good condition. HOWEVER, the one that they swindled my mother into buying from them, (a 1988 for over 10 THOUSAND DOLLARS!!!, Has been nothing but a headache! She has had to call them numerous times to come back out to fix things, And, after she herself bought a new hot water heater and paid to have it repainted, her washing machine was fried do to the faulty wiring!!!!! She had a 5 year warranty on the washing machine, but, that doesn't cover faulty wiring! And, the repair people from Lemmond came out and "fixed" the wiring, discovering that it was wired backwards! Now the Owner refuses to reimburse my mother for the loss of her washing machine. He has been extremely rude and disrespectful towards her. Even YELLING at her over the phone! Now he tells her to contact her insurance department?! Knowing full well that NO insurance company will insure this FIRETRAP!!

text: My wife and I were just browsing at local mobile home dealers, so we decided to check out Mundy. We were instantly greeted and asked what we were looking for in a home. We were shown several, beautiful homes and David was very patient with us, as we were looking around. It was cold outside, but David still allowed us to see any home we wanted to see. We finished our tour of the homes, and he sat with us and broke down prices of the models we were interested in. We were extremely pleased with the experience there and with the professionalism of David and the staff at Mundy. I would highly recommend them if you are looking to buy a new or used mobile home.

resp.text:
Daniel
Thank you for the positive review. We really appreciate it. David has been a part of the Mundy Home Center team since 1989. He really takes care of his customers before and after the sale. He is definitely family. We sure hope you become apart of our family of homeowners also.  Thanks again!

text: We purchased a home from Clayton homes and Tara was our sales rep. She is absolutely amazing! We went a few times to look at diff homes and trying to make sure we were making the right decision. She was very patient with us and answered any questions we had no matter what time of day it was. She took the time to ask us what we really wanted and what our budget was. We went back after doing our on research and thinking we knew exactly what we wanted until she said she had something she knew we would love and she was correct. Tara listen to us and really knew what we were looking for and showed us the perfect home. We fell in love as soon as we walked in. I also love the fact that she was never pushy and trying to talk us into buying something just to be buying. Overall it took us about two years to make a decision and she patiently waited and worked with us the whole time. Now we are just waiting for our new home to be built! We can’t wait! resp.text: Hi Marla, thank you for reaching out. Customer experience is of the upmost importance to us, and we take this feedback very seriously. name: April Wells
text: My husband and I had looked at MH in Huntsville and since we passed Clayton Homes in Athens one day, we decided to stop in. I was scared at first due to hearing their prices were high. The saleslady, Tara, greeted us and asked all the right questions before showing us what they had to match our criteria. I thought this process was great so she wouldn't waste our time nor did we waste hers. We found the one we wanted. We left and got maybe a mile down the road and didn't know what our next step would be. With Tara not bring a pushy sales person she told her to think about it and get back with her when we decided what to do next. So she was surprised when we walked back in. We went through the pre approval, she assisted with any questions we had. We got a quick response and went back to do final paperwork. I wanted to make sure this is the one we wanted and asked to look at a few more. Tara didn't hesitate to show us others. We then found the PERFECT one. We hope to be closed within a month or sooner. Tara is really great to work with. She keeps us informed every step of the way. I would recommend her to my family and friends. Plus, she's down to earth and has a beautiful smile.

name: Daniel Webster
text: My wife and I stopped here today to try and look at a few different models. With the kids gone we were unsure about how many bedrooms to get or what kind of house to do. We’ve been exploring modular, conventional as well as manufactured housing. We also needed to explore options for an in-law house on the same property so we were actually shopping for two houses. Today’s experience pretty well sealed the deal with staying away from a manufactured house. It was not a welcoming we expected and instead felt like a used car buying experience. The guy wanted to get info from us that we were not certain of yet and wasn’t happy with our time frame of inside of two years. When we told him we just wanted to look he replied back with, “ we only have two sales people and looking at all of them could take all day” being a business owner my self, if it takes me all day to make the customer happy, then so be it. We drove away, both telling each other that our business will stay far away from this place even if it means spending more money to do so.

resp.text: We are sorry to hear that your experience was not a positive one with Clayton of Athens. Our Sales Professionals want to understand as much about your home buying needs so we can provide you the best buying experience. If there is anything we can ever do in the future to meet your housing needs, please don’t hesitate to reach out us at 256-233-3101.

text:
We were really desperately searching for options for a home as the one we had just purchased on 23 acres was unlivable. Taylor saw our distress and immediately gave us reassuring confidence that she would do anything to calm our fears and make the process worry free.  We are retired and wanted to have a comfortable, easy care home that was all inclusive. Taylor took care of everything. She showed us beautiful homes from which to choose. The buying process was made a superb experience. Every single detail was taken care of professionally and we felt genuinely as ease confident that we would be in a new home designed with every custom detail to our satisfaction.
We are now two nights in our beautiful new home.
Taylor was wonderful. She took personal interest in us and we feel we made a friend not just a business relationship with Taylor.

name: Nicholas Ward
text: This is a very professional establishment, all my needs were met with my interest in buying a home from them. Mary Jane Johnson was very informative and knowledgeable of the process and also the homes themselves. Couldn't have asked for a better experience when dealing with a manufactured home dealer. Thank you for your personal interest in my situation and what fit me best in my search for a home. I genuinely enjoyed the service and respect I was handled with.

name: Terry Butler (Butler Team Roping)
text: Very bad customer service. Apparently you're not allowed to look at the homes without a salesperson opening every home for you one at a time. I've never seen that before. My husband and I waited in the office and walked around looking for someone. Of the several people that were in the office, no one acknowledged us. They just kept their eyes on their computer screens. We finally found another person on a tour and inquired about looking at houses. She gave us a quick reply that they were all locked and we couldn't look with out someone. There was no effort made to point us toward someone. I understand the houses being locked; however, if policy requires that someone open each house for perspective buyers, there should be sales people visible and available to speak with them. I've been to several Clayton Homes sales lots and have been given keys to open the homes and look at them at my own pace. They gave me a card and made sure I understood that they were there to answer any questions we had.  I personally do not like to have someone with me every step. I prefer to take my time and look at each home and weigh out the pros and cons and then speak with someone and ask questions. I can imagine this place had lost a considerable amount of business with this practice in place.

resp.text:
Hi Terry,

Thank you for your feedback. At Clayton Homes of Athens, we try to make sure all of our customers are helped right away and are given tours of all of the homes so we are available to answer any questions.  Our sales consultants also point out quite a few helpful features of our homes that you might not be aware of, such as our energy efficient windows and water heaters.  We also always keep our homes locked so they are protected for their future owner—we want to make sure everyone has a beautiful home. I’m sorry that you did not have a good experience this time. I would be happy to talk to you more about it, so please give me a call at 256-233-3101 at your convenience. Thank you! Roddy, General Manager

She replied "No we cant do that. We've got to sit down and talk to you and find out what youre looking for and what you want." I again explained that i just wanted to see the home. She flat out said she couldn't do that and dismissed herself. Ive never seen someone so rude and quick to dismiss doing business in my life. Her behavior is absolutely appalling! I will definitely not be doing any busy with your location because of her lack of professional behavior. She needs fired! How many more customers has she driven away?

(Taylor) wanted to get information some from me I explain that we were under time restraints and was needing to get to the hospital due to a family member sick. She proceeded to show me one trailer and we started walking back to the office I asked if that was all she was gonna show me and she said yes. Of course at that time I left and thanked her for her time. If you want to make a sale you need to get more sales training. I had time to look at 5 or 6 six trailers and it seemed because I would not take the time to fill out there information and sit down and chat about exactly what I was looking for she had not time for me!

name: Savannah Ziegler
text: Hi my name is Savannah Ziegler me and my husband are going through them and I love them

name: Tina Crim
text: Beautiful homes and very good customer service!

name: Tracey Dildine
text:
After walking through the of the sales office Terra said with notepad in hand. Good morning, have you been here before? We said no,and was going to say " we just want to look around"  and she immediately charged us through to an office, told us to fill out a form so we could see houses. We stated we had seen the houses on line and there was one in particular we wanted see, we were so excited to know there was one locally as we were possibly moving to VA in the near future Then she said, "well if your not going to buy from Us then Im not showing you any homes, as we have to be here for our customers that are going to buy for us, we have had 7 customers this morning and dont have time for you if your not buying. My jaw hit the floor. My husband ripped up the form and said lets go. I thought for a minute she was joking, but the look on her face was that of disgust for us asking to view the home. He walked out, I asked her seriously you not going to show us 2 homes? She said no and walked out. All this happened within the first minute of the conversation.
Disgusted and appalled at her lack of customer service skills and thoughtlessness  for people wanting ideas for their home, I can honestly say she should be fired. I have never been spoken to like that before. My husband, being in the AF for 21 years was looking for a place we could settle down in, but it won't be from your company. We then wandered around the lot, going over in our heads "did we do something wrong" and found Jennifer moving furnture we asked if we could poke our heads in the door and she was very kind enough to let us. We then saw another sales person, Mary Jane and she was unlocking the house we were so excited to see. I asked her if she minded us looking inside and she was most pleasant and said of course, not "are you buying from us, not, sign this first", just great customer service. Thank you for teaching that sales person some respect of others.
We then went over to the green house as Terra had just gone in, and I tried the door handle, and it was locked! She came to the door and held it so close to her that I couldnt see inside if I wanted too. She said if you go back to the office and sign the form I will let you see the houses, I asked "did you seriously lock the door so I couldnt poke my head in the door" she replied "yes". Again, floored by her attitude and I laughed out loud because it was just so childish. I hope her customers knew they were locked in with her!  She then said I have nothing more to say, and shut the door in my face!
Apparently at some point In the office I used the word "darn or dam" as I was so disgusted by our treatment, and she said you can go now, I won't have someone cussing at me. I'm from England and this isn't particularly a cuss word.
To summarise for those of you thinking of buying from Clayton Homes in Athens dont bother. You may get lucky enough to speak with Mary Jane or you may get Terra. Good luck. Yes, I have a call in to the boss Roddy and yes I will be notifying the better business bureau. We are no headed to Mundy homes to find our forever home...
Tracey.

text: We went to Clayton Homes because of the good reputation and advertisement. The lady that helped us, Jeanie I think, was very nice and helpful. She wasn't a pushy salesperson; she let us look around and talk to each other and think about it with out trying to force anything on us. That being said, it went downhill after that. Once we paid and signed and were gone, customer service was not as good. They told us it would be 2-3 weeks before we got our home. Friday of the second week we still had not heard from them so called and left a message that was never returned. Tuesday we called again and they tell us that it is on the way while we're both at work. So he had to leave work since no one gave us a heads up. There are still drawers for the kitchen and light fixtures sitting in the living room floor, there are some minor flaws in the structure, the crew littered all over our yard (water bottles, bolts, screws, pieces of metal), we have no steps and it'll be a week tomorrow that it was delivered. We're having to climb in and out using a 5 gallon bucket. After the delivery we were told people would be back and we should get a phone call, that hasn't happened yet. We paid upfront and they acted like since they got their money we meant nothing any more. I would not recommend this place.

resp.text: Ms. Thornton, We are extremely sorry you have had this experience. We spoke with Mr. Sprague yesterday and are sending our service manager to the home on Friday. We typically wait until power and water are connected to the home to complete service. It's easier to see everything that needs to be corrected. We are happy to accommodate you guys if you feel it needs to happen before then. Again, sorry for any inconvenience. Please feel free to call me if you would like to speak further. Thank you--Mark, GM

name: Chain Bender
text:
After a debacle in PC over the weekend trying to buy a home, Timberline Homes was like a class reunion. Bright smiling faces eager to answer questions and show you around the lot. Ms. Angie Cannon was our tour guide.  We gave her our ballpark sizes and numbers and things the home must have.  In just a few minutes she had a list of 5 homes for us to look out. We looked at all 5 homes, Really beautiful homes buy none of them had a solo, walk in shower.  As we stood on the steps of the last house she said that she did have one more home that we might like, but it was jus a little over our budget(only $3,000.00),  When we walked in the front door we were hooked.  Massive rooms, kitchen and living room.

our goal was to buy a 3-2 with a nice master and a second bedroom as large as possible and a great common bathroom,. This home suited our needs and then some. It was a 4-3.  We asked Angie Cannon what the price was with out taxes.  She told us.  My wife and my eyes lock on each other,  The hair on my neck and arms stood up like an Arctic Blast had just hit me.

My wife and I had a 2 minute huddle and decided to buy in.  What a relief to finally find the perfect home for us  So we all go back to her office to start the paperwork.  After less than 30 minutes we were the new owners of a 2021 Riverway,  2340 square feet, 4 bedrooms and three full baths.  Great baths.  Especially the master Bath.

The flow and openness of the home is so relaxing.  You can stand in one room and look all the way through the  home to the opposite end.  I think the Laundry Room, backdoor entrance was like 12X12 with a 7' square in the middle of the room for dropping laundry or fresh caught grouper on.

Daniel Wilson was the "paper work Guru"  he breezed through all the required paper work in only about 20-25 minutes,  He explained warranties and who to call if various items needed a touch up  He even gave us the name of the mover so he could get an idea of what the setup site and surrounding trees and bushed might hinder the installation and set up. and where the site actually is.  And then we were set free to go.

The communications between Angie, Daniel and us was terrific.  They even listened to some of my war stories and joke's. So refreshing compared to the coning zombies down in PC.  That became a night mare after I had signed the contract and given them a very sizable down payment.  That night I was looking through the "numbers" and found a $1,200.00 addition that my wife and I had clearly told the guy we absolutely DID NOT WANT their insurance, and another small $350 charge I was not going to pay.  Bottom line, I called the agent at his home Saturday night and told him I would be at his office Sunday at noon to pick up my deposit check.  The agent didn't how up but the number 2 man did.  When he opened the front door and changed the sign to open he had had time to listen to his voice mail.  I entered the office and called out his name.  He told me to come on in to his office.  I said, Well, I guess you have had time to listen to your voice mails already.  He said yeah and pointed to the front corner of his desk and said  There is your check"  He was not the least bit interested in hearing my side of the story or even looking through the office copies of my contract.  He didn't care or offer to make it right the least little bit.  There is over $3,000.00 in fees you really should question and discuss before you sign.  Buyer be wear there.

I need to close with a great big thank you to Angie Cannon, Daniel Wilson and Lisa Strickland for such a stress free place to do some major shopping in!  So guys, Sunny and I thank you all so much for your attentive service and relaxed and non pushy persona.

Timberline Homes Inc,  on Montgomery Highway  will treat you right and do everything they can to find you a home that meets your need.

AWESOME PLACE AND PEOPLE.

And Yes, I would recommend them to anyone.

name: Trina Hedquist
text:
Let me tell you all about how they flipped my mom's life upside down. Let me take a minute, just sit right there. I'll tell you how this business made my mom pull out her hair. (figuratively)

Let's start with Wayne (who is apparently fired and so is his manager) who signed a deal with my mom assuring her they could purchase her property of choice and put the property and trailer together. My mother was approved for an FHA loan and we found the PERFECT property. They told us they got the property owner to lower the price to 20K but really and secretly Wayne had it to 15,500.... not sure if his shady ways was what got him fired but I would say it's a good bet..... anyway... Wayne "forgot" to send the money for escrow to the property owner. They were supposed to close on the property on a Thursday in the beginning of April of 2021. The DAY BEFORE CLOSING ON THE PROPERTY we find out that Wayne didn't fill out any information for the corporate office to take care of closing info and he just "forgot" all about the closing at all. So then the seller of the property raised his fee (understandably) back to original cost and made big demands for the runaround.

Then we find out that Wayne is fired later and that his manager is too. Now we are told that they are going to put my mom with another guy named Austin (not the manager Austin) who allegedly is the FHA guy on the site. Well my mom already had a lender and was approved. This company INSISTS they will not buy the property unless she uses THEIR lender. And not to worry they do FHA. HA! Here's the rub this place is running the show like a used cars salesman and trying to wrangle deals that can't work for my mom. Her FHA was for 3.5% down...now they want 10% even though she is in the right score for the 3.5%. They tried to say she doesn't qualify or for the right amount her lender said she did. But my mom and brother were doing it together. In the meantime, they are REFUSING to buy this property they originally assured her they could buy with HER LENDER....suddenly that is no longer something they can do.

They want to force my mom off the FHA loan because they don't make as much and they can't add "points" to make money off of. I am not fooled. I worked in the housing industry. Most people buying modular and mobile are lower incomes and this company is using used car, predatory lending practices and it's gross. My mom had been looking for a house since FEBRUARY. It was going to be her very first home ever buying. She was so excited and this entire process has soured everything and she still doesn't have her home or her property and now has to just keep looking for a home because we refuse to let her do business with this shady company who was just looking to prey on my mom's limited knowledge on mortgages to their advantage. Do not go here. If you are lower income, this isn't the place for you. They have zero integrity and no transparency. Run as fast as you can the other way.

resp.text: Hi Trina, thanks for sharing your experience with us. Customer service is of the upmost importance to us and we take feedback very seriously. Can you please give us a call at 1-877-264-2812 so we can document your concerns? We'd like to loop in the appropriate parties here at the home office for support.

name: Anessa Hammel
text: Found our first home to buy! I thought it would be harder to find what we were looking for but it wasn't! They have a decent selection of mobile homes, single and double wide. What I like about Clayton Homes is that you walk in and could never even tell that you're in a mobile home. They have everything from 3 to 5 bedrooms with spacious rooms and huge master baths inside. The customer service was on point and if you decide to go, I definitely recommend asking for Kyle. He is very knowledgeable and gives you a chance to look around without hassling you. So far, so good and even though we haven't bought our home yet, I definitely recommend Clayton Homes in Pelham.

name: Michelle Reynolds
text: My Dad and Sister had a great experience with Kyle he was patient with us in making our decision. We came back the second time to do the paperwork. I along with my family would recommend Clayton Homes to friends and family. Kyle is fantastic🤗

text: Very nice selection of mobile homes and modular homes

text: Kyle is great!  I can be a pest about things but the people at Clayton have been pretty patient with me.  Only issues I've had are weather related delays but they have dealt with those and gotten a lot done in a little amount of time.

name: Dana Taff
text: If you buy one of these homes, expect it to immediately become a liability! During delivery process, walls fell down, I had water damage, all the molding was hanging loose. All the exterior siding has deep waves. I got the state involved in my attempt to have these things addressed. They came out and made an assessment, but when that was done, they basically said they couldn’t force them to fix anything. Pay careful attention to detail. Door plates, plastic toilet seats, raise the windows, molding, unfinished interiors of closets, just to mention a few. Better yet, if you have a choice, never but a mobile home from this place!!

name: Bernadette “Hurricane” Gauvin
text:
This is a quiet and beautiful community in close proximity to shopping and entertainment. It includes a well maintained pool, park and recreation hall.
Management is friendly, responsive and quick to address any issues that may arise . Maintenance is professional, friendly and gets the job done.
If you’re looking for a nice place that feels like a small community within the city for reasonable rates, I highly recommend checking this place out.

name: C Connolly
text: Great Company. The staff are professional, courteous and helpful. The homes they offer are beautiful, spacious and modern. The Company takes pride in the properties and it shows.

name: Me
text: Ok

name: Jessika Bailey
text: Moved in here for 915$  a month and EVERY thing wrong with this trailer BRAND new trailer and the doors wouldn't shut they screwed on the bolts on the toilet seat so tight they KEEP breaking and JUST found out the toilet in my master bathroom is freaking DUMPING UNDERNEATH the house.  SO unsanitary. DISGUSTING. And there is a kid that rides a dirt bike until 9pm at freaking night keeping my kids awake and they won't do anything about it and if they did the kid STILL does it anyways. Even after the police being called JUST yesterday because this kid almost hit 2 cars AGAIN NOT the first time.  😡😡😡 I CAN say the office manager is very sweet and does as she says she will do its just to live in a place that's SO expensive and a trailer if that other tenants should have respect for other tenants AND abide by the dang rules. Just the people PUTTING ALL these trailers together ARE putting them together SO FAST NOTHING is being put together RIGHT. I just feel so dirty knowing ALL the feces and urine is dumping under my trailer .DO NOT EVER MOVE IN HERE IF YOU WANNA MOVE IN SOMEWHERE FOR ALMOST 1000 A MONTH GO FIND A DECENT HOUSE. THIS IS NOT WORTH IT IM FED UP WITH THIS PLACE AND IVE ONLY LIVED HERE FOR 3 WEEKS . ITS TUESDAY AND MY TOILET HAS BEEN DUMPING UNDER MY HOUSE THAT I KNOW OF SINCE SUNDAY .THEY PUT PEOPLE IN NOT READY TRAILERS. They also do NOT tell you you HAVE to pay AND have renters insurance which is another 50$ a month so you ARE paying 1000$a month. Its ridiculous. Will NEVER rent from these people again and will NEVER reccmmend these people.

resp.text: Hi Jessika, I am sorry to see your review about the plumbing issue with your brand new Southern Energy Mobile Home. Your opinion matters to us and is important. It is unfortunate that the plumbing issue occurred and we sincerely apologize for the problem. It is always very important that any maintenance issues are reported immediately and directly to the office so that we can have one of the onsite management come by and fix it before it becomes a major problem. I understand that the issue was reported on Tuesday and the onsite staff came over Tuesday that same day to correct the problem. We are very diligent about enforcing the rules of the community in order to make it a safe and enjoyable place to live for everyone. If you know where the resident lives, who is riding the dirt bike, please report it directly to the office so they can address it with a written notice to ensure the behavior stops. We do not want your family or anyone disturbed in the community. We hope that we can work towards repairing your faith in us so that you stay. Please contact me directly if you wish to discuss anything. 757-650-7145. Thank you.

name: Amy Hobbs
text: Great employees

name: Valerie Beasley
text: The sale rep.  Helen was excellent. Unfortunately she is not there now. She answered all calls day and night. Once they got my mom to sign on the dotted line, she was lied to repeatedly about someone coming out to fix the repairs that was done through manufacturing or during transport of the trailer. She has had the trailer since October or November of 2020 and I have been calling repeatedly to get someone to come out and make repairs. Who wants to live in a used trailer and paying for a new trailer.

resp.text: Hey Valerie, I'm sorry to hear that you were unhappy with the service you received at Regional Home of Mobile. Our number one priority is to meet and exceed expectations at every interaction. Since we don't have much control over the manufacturer servicing, we do everything in our power to get issues resolved for you quickly but that's not always the case. We will keep working hard to get these issues taken care of more promptly!

text: It is going on month three of owning my home and I can say that not one room in my home is complete. Because I have without a doubt fell through the cracks with Regional & Cappaert Homes!! Never Again!!

name: Rhonda Edwards
text: Quite a bit to choose from, but then we're in the middle of a pandemic, so to order what you want would take nearly 4 to 6 months. Also, they are in such demand, that they won't consider a cash discount...cuz they can get whatever price they put on 'em... And even if that's the case, why would you admit that? Just sayin'!!!

name: Tonya Lockett-Shamburger
text: I am completely not satisfied with how this process has went. We purchased our home in January it was delivered in February here it is August and they  regional or cappaert have not completed or tried to complete our beautiful home that wasn't cheap. We have been more than patient and understanding we haven't received not one phone call.  After letting them know our home  wasn't completed. After leaving messages. I have called, emailed, & sent pictures of the incomplete work. I can say that not one room in my home is complete.  Cappaert called  in July to see  if we were enjoying our new home. I told them its not completed.I sent  pictures of the horrible craftsmanship done. Walls separated, nails sticking out trimming coming apart . Didnt receive the kitchen Drawers cabinets coming loose from the wall. I have a 11 month old & this new home we purchased isn't safe .  Haven't heard anything else from them.I'm so disappointed with Regional & Cappaert Homes!! Never Again!! The only thing I'm satisfied with is The sales rep Helen was awesome in the purchasing process helped any way she could any time of day & night due to my work schedule to get me my HOME & in my home NO complaints with her. I thank her for her time. If everyone else would do what they suppose to do. Im not asking for anything extra. I just want my home completed correctly. I don't know what else to do. Who else to call & they don't give me the run around. please just complete the work.

text: We have had our manufactured home for a year now and I can say I am completely not satisfied with how this whole process has went.been lied to multiple time,and they had workers in our home making repairs,so they called it but made it ten times worse!! Our home does not look brand new it looks like a used home,it was in perfect shape when we looked at it on the lot.we have had people out here 5 times to work on it and fix it and it still is not done!!! Plus all the baseboards around the windows along the floor and ceiling are messed up and even cabinets look bad because someone decided to use flat paint on the shiny parts so we have patches throughout our whole house,plus our front door is not leveled and it is crooked. If we could go back in time I would definitely of not bought a home from here. I wish they would fix what needs to be done instead of saying they can't do it.

text: Would not recommend this place to anyone. They are not true to there word with fixing the things that have went wrong. My daughter bought a home from them and it has been nothing but a headache trying to get them to fix the problems . Home is very unlevel, the doors have inch gapps in them, rain water coming threw back door, one room has to have new paneling due to it being so unlevel. It's just horrible that my child works so hard for what she has and then you have sorry buisnesses like this that don't care...

resp.text: Sandy - we apologize for any inconvenience. Please give our main office number a call and ask to speak with the General Manager, Sean, and he will help you get this taken care of. Customer Service is our #1 priority.

name: Jodie McKinley
text:
We are shopping for a new mobile home and this is the first place we visited. After talking to Tiffany, she steered us in the right direction and gave us ideas on which homes we’d probably like to look at first. It was a Saturday and this place was super busy. We had made an appointment but it was apparent that Tiffany was overwhelmed with customers and she was unable to give us much of her time (although not her fault, she was there with only one other guy who didn’t seem to know much about anything). We were able to tour the homes at our leisure and their houses are all high end and very nice. There was no pressure to purchase anything.

I deducted a point for the state of their sales “yard”. It is packed dirt pocked full of dips and holes and loose gravel so make sure you wear good comfortable shoes. If I was the owner I would make repairs to this area as it’s a liability waiting to happen (I almost sprained my ankle twice) and it doesn’t look nice.

resp.text: Hey Jodie - thanks for your honest opinion! We are aware that the lot yard needs some maintenance and are planning on having that fixed very soon!

name: Christian Cunningham
text: I only give one star because i have to in order to give a review. We heard so many good things about this company and thats why we went with them; however, I regret that every single day. We have been having our home going on 3 months and it has yet to be fixed. They bent our frame, the walls have buckles in them, our house isnt even leveled. Ive tried to contaxt them over and over and no one replies. Tiffany was an outstanding sales rep and she definitely made us feel at ease with everything. However, the depts above her including the general manager is only worried about money. Looks as if we will have to get a lawyer involved just to get our home repaired.

resp.text: Sandy - we apologize for any inconvenience. Please give our main office number a call and ask to speak with the General Manager, Sean, and he will help you get this taken care of. Customer Service is our #1 priority.
